description: {"blocks":[{"key":"eldfp","text":"This protocol describes the laboratory process for the use of run controls (positive and negative controls)\nfor performing direct detection of poliovirus by nanopore sequencing (DDNS assay). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"539o7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qr67","text":"The protocol outlines the key steps of how and when to use the run controls for DDNS assay including preparation,  and storage. The run controls are used to demonstrate that the entire DDNS workflow starting from RNA extraction to obtaining a sequence is successfully performed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4v7p1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4oa6","text":"        \nPositive control (Coxsackievirus A20)  – Supplied by MHRA, contact Dr. Erika Bujaki at erika.bujaki@mhra.gov.uk.  and Dr. Thomas Wilton at thomas.wilton@mhra.gov.uk.  and copy Dr. Javier Martin at javier.martin@mhra.gov.uk).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":96,"length":24},{"key":1,"offset":148,"length":25},{"key":2,"offset":206,"length":25}],"data":{}},{"key":"cgfkh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"8C4930FF66AE11EFA4190A58A9FEAC02","url":"mailto:erika.bujaki@mhra.gov.uk"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"8C4930FF66AE11EFA4190A58A9FEAC02","url":"mailto:thomas.wilton@mhra.gov.uk"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"8C4930FF66AE11EFA4190A58A9FEAC02","url":"mailto:javier.martin@mhra.gov.uk"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"94ja2","text":"Reconstitution of the positive control","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"claae","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a8l4c","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"944u4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1fnhd","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6o83c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bbfpr","text":"The CVA20 positive control must be reconstituted before use. No attempt should be made to weigh out the freeze dried material","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":19,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"8eonq","text":"Infectious material –  Handle virus in a Class II Microbiological Safety Cabinet (MSCII)","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ovbq","text":"Working in the MSCII, reconstitute the vial containing the lyophilised CVA20 (freeze dried material) by adding 1mL of nuclease free water (NFW)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8uqo1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5k80q","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"439af","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"alt":"","guid":"03CA499D661D11EF8B450A58A9FEAC02","height":99,"id":495877,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Image 1.PNG","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/recwbrd2p.png","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/reifbrd2p.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/reiebrd2p.webp","width":189}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8v0jc","text":"Vortex briefly to ensure that the material completely dissolves in water giving a colourless liquid","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3j95","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cmu40","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bbc8n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"alt":"","guid":"337F5A39661D11EF8B450A58A9FEAC02","height":103.420814479638,"id":495879,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Image 2.PNG","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/recybrd2p.png","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/reihbrd2p.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/reigbrd2p.webp","width":211.6296296296296}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3nj4f","text":" Aliquot the solution into single-use volumes of 30 µl in  1.5mL sterile eppendorf tubes (DNase/RNase free) and store all aliquots at -200C for future use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":137,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9no09","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"sd5t","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"75v8p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpe7t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"eiuin","text":"The operator must label the tubes with the date the positive control was reconstituted. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6oaed","text":"Aliquots of the resuspended CVA20 can be store at -20°C for up to 5 weeks. Aliquoting
will reduce the chance of source contamination as well as help to preserve the
stability of the CVA20 solution by reducing the number of freeze-thaw cycles of
the entire solution.     ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Use of the positive extraction control (CVA20) and negative extraction control during RNA extraction
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6e6m0","text":"    Prepare the CVA20 positive extraction control for RNA extraction as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7i978","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"577ui","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e8vdi","text":"Include a positive extraction control and a negative extraction control for every RNA extraction\nbatch with new preparations of solutions.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Use of the positive extraction control (CVA20) and negative extraction control during RNA extraction
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5941n","text":" Retrieve a 30 µl aliquot of the CVA20 from the -20°C freezer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Use of the positive extraction control (CVA20) and negative extraction control during RNA extraction
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4g2i4","text":"Allow to thaw at room temperature whilst in the MSCII cabinet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Use of the positive extraction control (CVA20) and negative extraction control during RNA extraction
Use of the positive extraction control (CVA20) and negative extraction control during RNA extraction
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a24v1","text":"Add 270 µl of NFW and pipette up and down to mix the solution. The solution is now ready for immediate RNA extraction .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3q3ja","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c1m4f","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1sg4p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3iu8l","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1ea9r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"alt":"","guid":"B661D039662111EF8B450A58A9FEAC02","height":165.1875,"id":495881,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Image 3.PNG","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/redxbrd2p.png","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/reijbrd2p.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/reiibrd2p.webp","width":377.57142857142856}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5hb1o","text":"It is the responsibility of the operator to check that the batch positive control is added to the process.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Use of the positive extraction control (CVA20) and negative extraction control during RNA extraction
Use of the positive extraction control (CVA20) and negative extraction control during RNA extraction
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4me05","text":" Perform RNA extraction of the samples in parallel with the positive and negative controls. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Use of the positive extraction control (CVA20) and negative extraction control during RNA extraction
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ccg10","text":"Aliquot 300 µl of nuclease free water (NFW) into a sterile 1.5ml Eppendorf tube (DNase/RNase free) labelled ExNTC (extraction negative control)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aq4kd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brfht","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"abe2i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"alt":"","guid":"44E9DB87662611EF8B450A58A9FEAC02","height":148,"id":495883,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Image 4.PNG","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/reebbrd2p.png","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/reimbrd2p.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/reikbrd2p.webp","width":185}}}}

steps.section: Use of the positive extraction control (CVA20) and negative extraction control during RNA extraction
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fumnd","text":"The elutes / purified RNA from the controls and samples following RNA extraction can now be processed according to the DDNS protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjd4j","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9msti","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bb149","text":"The elutes /purified RNA should be kept on ice after extraction and while working with it. If the eluted RNA is not for immediate use, store at - 80°C","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
